intro: Eriosema bianoense, commonly known as the white-flowered eriosema, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has a compact growth habit and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Eriosema bianoense is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
